result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ariana Kristin Cloud

records.addlTxt: Atty Masana acknowledges rec. information, waives reading, stands mute.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties and enters NG plea.  Atty Masana requests TSC.  Court will do internal review in about 30 days.  Bond continued.

9:55 AM Defendant Ariana Kristin Cloud in court.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Ariana Kristin Cloud.  Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  Atty Masana states DE will waiver her right to prelim.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause/binds DE over.
Preliminary hearing on October 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:09 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ariana Kristin Cloud in court.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Ariana Kristin Cloud.  Court states case and appearances.  Atty Masana requests prelim.  Court confirms address - DE states it's not valid but she can still get mail there.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 13, 2022 at 10:15 am.

2:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ariana Kristin Cloud appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Leonie Dolch appeared by video for Ariana Kristin Cloud.  Court states case and Atty Dolch explains nonappearance by DE.  Court clarifies the DE's phone number.  Atty Dolch states DE doesn't have a phone.  State makes bail argument - requests $250 cash bond.  Court orders the previous bond to continue.
Return date scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on August 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on April 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:45 AM Defendant Ariana Kristin Cloud in court.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes previous warrant based on DE's non-appearance.  DE wishes to have counsel.  Court reviews financial information.  Court finds conditionally indigent.  Court appoints Attorney Peter Masana, 128 2nd Avenue, Baraboo, WI 53913 (608) 448-4109 @$100/hr and reimbursement @ $50.00/month commencing May 1, 2022, directly to the Sauk County Clerk of Courts.  DE confirms mailing address.  DE waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court finds waiver free, knowing and voluntary.  Matter reset.  Bond continues.

10:07 AM Defendant Ariana Kristin Cloud not in court.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin and Officer McKendree.  Court advises DE contacted the Court to advise she was having transportation issues.  DE was advised to be present and DE advised she may be late.  State requests a warrant.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.

01:48 PM Defendant Ariana Kristin Cloud in court.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  Time limits NOT waived for preliminary hearing.  DE waives right to an attorney to receive the offer.  DE received the CSR in court.  DE updates address.  $2,250.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: Booking Today.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant called to schedule hearing to quash warrant.  Advised that the warrant was being quashed but she would need to appear in person for the rescheduled initial appearance on 3/16/22 at 1 pm in Branch 4.  And if she did not appear the warrant would again be authroized.  Tried to confirm the mailing address as listed on CCAP.  That is where her mail goes but she doesn't necessarily reside there.

Based on the letter to the Court filed 3/3/22 (Doc. 7) Judge Screnock authorized the warrant to be quashed.  This matter to be reset for an initial appearance at which time, if the defendant does not appear, a warrant may again be authorized.
from ADA Arevalo to Br 1
